column4: Hey I'm trying to install one deb package without installing lib*-mesa,  is it possible ?
using dpkg ?
use the repositories through APT, don't use .deb you download
it's not in repository
I have package
what is "it" exactly?
Panda3D arm build
then you need to download a .deb meant for your version of ubuntu and satisfy requirements manually (by installing them from APT)
I have deb package
they seem to have a ppa on their website (http://www.panda3d.org/download.php?platform=ubuntu&version=1.0.0&runtime) are you using that?
no
can't I just add --ignore-depends=libegl-mesa etc.
not really, unless you know you can.  Dependencies are there because a package needs another package to work right.  Use the ppa: https://launchpad.net/~panda3d/+archive/ppa
I know I should ignore those dependencies
use the ppa
did that work?
I'm already talking with that rdb guy, to make that build work so I have to build with ignoring those dependencies to not use those libraries
then download the source package, remove the dependency, rebuild the package, and file a bug somewhere
can't you just tell how to ignore packages ?
no, this is the proper way.  You can force dpkg to install without the dep but then you'll always get complaints about it.  So rebuilding as I described is the optimal way to fix your issue.
if you really want to ignore my advice, you can just take two minutes in the dpkg man page and search for "ignore-dep" I suppose...
